content.raw:
This is an excellent point. Sorry for not mentioning it in the description of the pull request. I thought of two options for dealing with this issue, which I will describe below. I didn't like either one, so I haven't implemented them yet.

* Currently the plugin listens to the default spacenav topic `~/user_camera/joy_twist`, which is the same as the viewpoint controller. The conflict could be avoided by disabling the spacenav viewport control by telling this plugin to listen to a different topic and specifying a different spacenav topic in the gui.ini file.
* We could also try to match the button logic from UserCamera.cc (see pull request #1249). I don't like this idea because the plugin and viewport could get out of sync if one of them misses a message. Also, it's basically putting logic in two places that would need to stay in sync.
